question.title: Issue with Regex Pattern (split string with characters & numbers)
question.body:
Issue: The string split using Regex pattern is not working as per expectation

String: TAXABLE VALUE OF SUPPLY (FEES) 11.97 DR11.97 DR0.00 CR

Required Output: String Array as below

  • TAXABLE VALUE OF SUPPLY (FEES)
  • 11.97 DR
  • 11.97 DR
  • 0.00 CR

Regex Pattern used: (?<=\d{1,}.\d{2} (DR|CR))

Output (using the above regex):

  • TAXABLE VALUE OF SUPPLY (FEES) 11.97 DR
  • 11.97 DR
  • 0.00 CR

As seen from the above, the string is not getting split at the first 11.97 DR. Hope the issue faced is clear, any pointers on what I need to change to get the split as per my need will help.

Code:

String text = "TAXABLE VALUE OF SUPPLY (FEES) 11.97 DR11.97 DR0.00 CR";
String[] parts = text.split("(?<=\d{1,}\.\d{2} (DR|CR))");
System.out.println(parts);

Added: Some of the other lines which needs to be split using regex

  • text1 = "TAXABLE VALUE OF SUPPLY (SHIP CHARGE) 192.57 DR192.57 DR0.00 CR"
  • text2 = "TAXABLE VALUE OF SUPPLY (DEPOT TAX) 520.00 DR520.00 DR0.00 CR"
  • text3 = "IGST* RATE:18% AMOUNT (RS.) 401.19 DR401.19 DR0.00 CR"
